section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The permissible trailer loads, axle weights, drawbar node weights, and the permissible gross vehicle weight are specified in the technical data.
Possibilities for increasing the loads can be requested from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
The vehicle is equipped with an enhanced suspension system on the rear axle and, depending on the vehicle type, with a more powerful cooling system.

section.title: Towing mode
section.paragraph: The Australia-New Zealand standard, AS 4177.1-2004 Caravan and light trailer towing components – trailer hitches and towing brackets, contains the following stipulations that the BMW Group Australia herewith adopts: ONLY FOR TRAILER OPERATION. The trailer tow hitch delivered with your BMW vehicle should only be used for towing purposes, and not in combination with any kind of transport device that is attached to the trailer hitch, i.e. a bicycle rack or similar.

Since all towing devices from the BMW Group are designed, checked, and approved as a unit, modifications or exchange of the ball head support unit delivered by BMW are not permissible. Please use the original BMW ball head support unit only.

The installation and use of load distributing trailer hitches or trailer load distribution equipment is neither recommended nor approved by the BMW Group Australia for any vehicle of the BMW Group. Using these kinds of devices can affect the vehicle's warranty status.
Additional advice and information can be obtained from an authorized BMW center.

section.title: Drawbar nose weight
section.paragraph: Do not undershoot the minimum drawbar nose weight of 25 kg25 kg, approx. 55 lbs55 lbs/25 kg and do utilize the maximum drawbar nose weight, if possible.

The maximum payload of the towing vehicle is reduced by the weight of the trailer hitch and the drawbar nose weight. The drawbar nose weight increases the vehicle weight. Do not exceed the approved gross vehicle weight of the towing vehicle.

section.title: Loading
section.paragraph: Distribute cargo as evenly as possible on the loading platform.
Stow the payload as low and close to the trailer axle as possible. A low center of gravity in the trailer increases the driving safety of the entire car-trailer combination.
Do not exceed the approved gross vehicle weight of the trailer and the permissible trailer load of the vehicle. The smaller value applies in each case.

section.title: Tire pressure
section.paragraph: Note the tire inflation pressure of the vehicle and trailer.
For the vehicle, the tire inflation pressure for higher loads applies.
For the trailer, the specifications of the manufacturer apply.
Additional information:
Tire pressure specifications.

section.title: Flat tire monitor
section.paragraph: After correcting the tire pressure or hitching/unhitching a trailer, initialize the Flat Tire Monitor.
Additional information:
Flat tire monitor.

section.title: Tire pressure monitor
section.paragraph: After correcting the tire pressure or hitching/unhitching a trailer, reset the Tire Pressure Monitor.
Additional information:
Tire pressure monitor.

section.title: Exterior mirrors
section.paragraph: Exterior mirrors, which allow the driver to see both rear edges of the trailer, are available as optional accessories from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

Legislation requires two exterior mirrors that allow the driver to see both rear edges of the trailer. Such mirrors are available as optional accessories from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Before start of the trip, check the function of the trailer tail lights.
Keep the activation times of the electrical components short during camper operation to save the vehicle battery power.

section.title: Trailer tail lights
section.paragraph: The consumption of the trailer tail lights must not exceed the following values:

item.paragraph: Turn signals: 42 watts per side.
Rear lights: 50 watts per side.
Brake lights: 84 watts in total.
Rear fog lights: 42 watts in total.
Backlight: 42 watts in total.
Turn signals: 54 watts per side.
Turn signals/brake lights: 54 watts per side.
Rear lights: 100 watts in total.
Brake lights: 108 watts in total.
Backlight: 54 watts in total.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: When driving with a trailer or rear-mounted luggage rack, some driver assistance systems are unavailable or only available to a limited extent. A Check Control message is displayed where applicable.
When driving with a trailer or load carrier and the trailer power socket is not occupied, some driver assistance systems may have functional limitations or may malfunction.
To prevent malfunctions, activate trailer towing.

When the trailer socket is occupied or trailer towing is activated, some driver assistance systems are unavailable, or available to a limited extent. A Check Control message is displayed where applicable.
Additional information:
Use of the trailer or rear-mounted luggage rack.

overview.overview-text: Adapt your speed when driving with a trailer

warning.paragraph: Depending on the design and loading of trailers, they may begin swinging at speeds exceeding approx. 80 km/h80 km/h, approx. 50 mph50 mph/80 km/h. There may be a risk of accident or risk of damage to property.
Adapt your speed when driving with a trailer. Immediately brake in the case of swinging. Apply necessary steering corrections as carefully as possible.

overview.overview-text: Increase the tire inflation pressure and observe maximum speed

warning.paragraph: The tire inflation pressure must be adjusted to the increased axle weight in trailer towing. Driving with too low tire inflation pressure can damage the tires. There may be a risk of accident or risk of damage to property. Do not exceed a speed of 100 km/h100 km/h / 60 mph60 mph / 100 km/h. Increase the tire inflation pressure of the towing vehicle by 0.2 bar. Note the maximum possible tire inflation pressure indicated on the tire.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: In the interest of safety and to avoid hindering the smooth flow of traffic, the towing of trailers is permissible on uphill grades up to 12 %.
If higher trailer loads are approved at a later point in time, the gradient limit is 8%.

section.title: Driving off on uphill grades
section.paragraph: The parking brake is automatically released when the accelerator pedal is activated.
In order to prevent rolling back when driving off, use the parking brake.

action-step.paragraph: Pull and release switch before driving off.
The parking brake is set.
Step on the accelerator pedal sufficiently to drive off.

section.title: Hills
section.paragraph: A car-trailer combination has the tendency to swing more readily on hills.
Manually downshift to the next-lowest gear before driving on a hill and drive downhill slowly.
Depending on vehicle equipment, change gear using the shift paddle or selector lever position D/L.
Before going downhill, shift to selector lever position B and drive downhill slowly.

warning.paragraph: On long trips with heavy trailer loads, high outside temperatures and low tank capacity, the fuel system can overheat, which reduces the engine power. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Refuel promptly. On long trips with heavy trailer loads and high outside temperatures, ensure that the fuel tank is more than 1/4 full.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Trailer Assistant helps when reversing with a trailer.
When reversing, the steering of the front wheels is accepted.

section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This system may not be available in the owned vehicle, e.g. due to the selected optional equipment, the national-market version or the option for later enabling and software updates. This also applies to individual functions of the system.

Information on whether a function is currently available in the vehicle and if or when the function can be installed in the vehicle can be obtained from an authorized service center or other qualified service center.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The kink angle determines the angle between the vehicle and trailer and thus the desired direction of travel of the car-trailer combination in reverse.
With the Trailer Assistant, the car-trailer combination is not guided by the steering wheel when reversing, but by continuous input and correction of the kink angle on the control display.
The system takes over the steering. The speed must be controlled by the driver using the accelerator pedal and the brake.
Follow the information in the "Parking assistance systems" chapter.
Additional information:
Parking assistance systems.

overview.overview-text: Observe surrounding traffic and adapt driving style

warning.paragraph: The system cannot serve as a substitute for the driver’s personal judgment in assessing the traffic situation. Based on the limits of the system, it cannot independently react to all traffic situations. There is a risk of accident. Adjust driving style to traffic conditions. Watch the surrounding traffic situation closely, be ready to take over steering and braking at any time, and actively intervene where appropriate.

overview.overview-text: Observe surrounding traffic and intervene where appropriate

warning.paragraph: The system can steer the vehicle over or onto curbs. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Watch surrounding traffic closely and actively intervene where appropriate.

item.paragraph: A trailer must be attached and connected.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, trailer towing must be activated.
The drawbar length of the trailer used must be adjusted depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version.
The rearview camera must be clean and clear.

section.title: Turning operating tips on/off
section.paragraph: Operating tips can be displayed for easier operation of the Trailer Assistant.

action-step.paragraph: Select the BMW ID or driver profile.
Attach and connect trailer to vehicle.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, activate trailer towing on the control display.
Press the button when the vehicle is stationary.
The parking assistance systems view is displayed.
The control display shows the rearview camera with a view of the tow bar and a stylized view of the vehicle with the trailer.
Shift into reverse.
Set the desired kink angle.
Follow the instructions on the Control Display where required.
Take your hands off the steering wheel and carefully drive in reverse with the accelerator pedal and the brake.
Green: the system takes control of steering.
When driving in reverse, observe the vehicle's surroundings.
In case of obstacles, stop immediately and take over control of the vehicle.
If necessary, adjust the kink angle while driving to correct the direction.
Engage selector lever position P when finished maneuvering.

section.title: Canceling Trailer Assistant manually
section.paragraph: Maneuvering of the car-trailer combination can be aborted manually:

section.title: Canceling Trailer Assistant automatically
section.paragraph: The system automatically cancels in situations such as the following:

item.paragraph: When the driver grasps the steering wheel or takes over steering.
When shifting from reverse to selector lever position D, the Trailer Assistant switches to standby mode.
If reverse is engaged again after a short distance, the function is active again.
During activation or intervention by driver assistance systems.
When the view on the control display is overlaid with messages.
In case of a slippery surface.
When the vehicle is rolling, such as on a slope.
In case of changed ambient conditions.
If the vehicle speed exceeds approx. 10 km/h10 km/h, approx. 6 mph6 mph/10 km/h.

section.title: Turning trailer protection brake on/off
section.paragraph: Whenever the Trailer Assistant is canceled, the trailer protection brake is then applied and the vehicle is secured at a standstill. As a result, the car-trailer combination cannot continue to roll uncontrolled. This function can be turned on and off.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The maximum speed is limited to approx. 10 km/h10 km/h, approx. 6 mph6 mph/10 km/h.
A warning is given at a speed of approx. 7 km/h7 km/h, approx. 4 mph4 mph/7 km/h.
If the maximum speed is exceeded, the function is interrupted.

section.title: Functional limitations
section.paragraph: Accessories on the tow bar such as a bicycle carrier or special shapes of the tow bar and trailer can restrict the function while maneuvering or lead to a collision.
Trailers with fifthwheel steering are not supported.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Trailer stabilization control helps by absorbing the swinging movements of the trailer.
The system detects swinging and automatically brakes the vehicle quickly in order to leave the critical speed range and stabilize the car-trailer combination.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: If the trailer power socket is occupied but a trailer has not been hitched, the system can also become active in extreme driving situations, e.g., when using a bicycle rack with lighting.

section.title: Functional requirement
section.paragraph: The system is functional at speeds beginning at approx. 65 km/h65 km/h, approx. 40 mph40 mph/65 km/h while a trailer is being towed and the trailer power socket is occupied.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The system cannot intervene or not intervene in time in the following situations, for instance:

item.paragraph: If a trailer jackknifes suddenly, for instance on slippery roads or loose surfaces.
If a trailer with a high center of gravity tilts, before swinging is detected.
If Dynamic Stability Control is deactivated or has malfunctioned.
When the power consumption of a trailer is too low, for instance due to tail lights with LED technology, to be detected by the system.

title.pcdata-case: Use of the trailer or rear-mounted luggage rack

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: When driving with a trailer or load carrier, e.g., a rear-mounted luggage rack, and the trailer power socket is not occupied, some driver assistance systems may have limited functionality or may malfunction. To avoid malfunctions, activate use of the trailer or rear-mounted luggage rack manually.

When the trailer power socket is occupied, a selection menu is shown on the control display. In the selection menu, specify whether the vehicle is to be driven with a trailer or rear-mounted luggage rack.

overview.overview-text: Noting the correct settings in the selection menu

warning.paragraph: If the control display is configured incorrectly, some driver assistance systems may have limited functionality or malfunction. There is a risk of accident. Make sure that the corresponding setting is enabled when using the trailer or rear-mounted luggage rack.

action-step.paragraph: Press the button.
Select whether the vehicle is driven with a trailer or rear-mounted luggage rack.

title.pcdata-case: Trailer hitch with electrically swiveled ball head

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The extendable ball head is located on the underside of the vehicle.

overview.overview-text: Check that the ball head is locked

warning.paragraph: If the ball head is not locked, this can lead to instable driving conditions or accidents. There may be a risk of accident or risk of damage to property. Before driving with a trailer or load carrier, check that the ball head is properly locked.
The LED in the button lights up red if the ball head is not locked properly.

overview.overview-text: Swivel in the ball head when driving without trailer

warning.paragraph: The trailer hitch is intended to be used with a trailer. If the ball head of the trailer hitch is swiveled out, it may become jammed when driving without a trailer or load carrier. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Swivel the ball head in when driving without a trailer or load carrier.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The button for extending/retracting the ball head is located in the cargo area.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: Vehicle is parked in a horizontal position.
Trailer power socket not occupied.
Trailer towing not activated.
The state of charge of the vehicle battery is sufficient.

section.paragraph: The LED in the button lights up green when the system is ready for operation.

action-step.paragraph: Open the cargo area.
Step out of the swiveling range of the ball head behind the vehicle.
Press the button in the cargo area.
The ball head extends. The LED flashes green.
Wait until the ball head has reached the end position and audibly locks.
Disconnect any trailer or load carrier.
If necessary, remove the attachments for the track stabilization systems.
Unplug the connector for the trailer power supply; and if needed, the adapter.
Press the button in the cargo area.
The ball head retracts. The LED flashes green.
Wait until the ball head reaches the end position.

section.title: Interrupting or reversing the swivel movement
General information
section.paragraph: The swivel movement is stopped or may be reversed or not carried out if the electrical limit values are exceeded; for example, when temperatures are very low or when there is mechanical resistance. LED illuminates red.

title.pcdata-case: Repeat swivel movement with engine running
Repeat swivel movement with drive-ready state switched on

action-step.paragraph: Turn on drive-ready state.
Press and hold the button in the cargo area, until the ball head is completely retracted or extended.

section.paragraph: Repeat swivel movement as needed with the button pressed and held and the engine running.
Repeat swivel movement with button pressed and activated drive-ready state.
The LED in the button lights up green, when the ball head reaches an end position.
If the swivel movement is interrupted repeatedly, contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The trailer power socket is located on the trailer hitch.

section.title: Loop for safety line

graphic-with-description.paragraph: There is a loop on the trailer hitch for attaching the trailer safety line.

section.paragraph: Secure the trailer safety line to the loop for increased safety when driving with a trailer.
Ensure that the safety line can move freely and is not dragging on the ground.

section.title: Operating rear-mounted luggage racks
section.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment, the ball head of the trailer coupling can be used as a mount for rear luggage racks such as bicycle carrier systems.
Follow the information on rear-mounted luggage racks when operating the rear luggage rack.
Additional information:
Rear-mounted luggage rack.

section.title: Brake Controller
section.paragraph: The vehicle manufacturer recommends that you have a Brake Controller installed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Information on installing a Brake Controller can be obtained from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
